snippet: Galen Rupp, the silver medalist in the 10,000-meter race, faces the 5,000-meter with counsel from his former high school coach and the company of his training partner, the British runner Mo Farah.
abstract: American distance runner Galen Rupp, who took the silver medal in the 10,000 meters, and his training partner Mo Farah of Britain are preparing for the 5,000 meters at the 2012 Olympics; as of yet, no American has won Olympic medals in both events.
lead_paragraph: Galen Rupp, the silver medalist in the 10,000-meter race, faces the 5,000-meter with counsel from his former high school coach and the company of his training partner, the British runner Mo Farah.

headline.seo: Galen Rupp Primes for Olympic 5,000 Meters
headline.main: Rupp Primes for 5,000 Meters With Help From Old Friends
headline.print_headline: Feeling Tired, but Primed to Win With a Kick
